comments: a(n) = 0 when n = 0 or when n is a 3-repdigit (A002277). a(n) = n when it contains no 3 among its digits. - _Alonso del Arte_, Oct 16 2012
example: a(13) = 1 because after deleting the 3 from its base 10 representation, we're left with 1.a(14) = 14 because there are no 3s to delete.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
